page.title: 02Laughton, Hopes and Fears, 1
page.content: We interviewed Mrs. Hoggard, who has always lived in our area. She is nearly ready to retire from her job at our school, so we wanted to know about her hopes and fears. The first things Mrs. Hoggard said she was worried about were vandalism and unemployment. She thought it would help if a policeman walked the streets like in the olden days. This would help stop vandalism. Even so, the village is still quiet, but busier than when she was younger. Unemployment worried her a lot, but she didn't know what could be done. Mrs. Hoggard has never lived anywhere else but in this area. She said that she wouldn't like to live in a built-up area. She has lived in a stone cottage but prefers her brick built house she now lives in.
